title: 'The emperor Zenon and the Isaurians'

LRE I 389-402.'Isaurians' were not so much a distinct ethnic group as simply mountaineers living around the city of Isaura. Their personal names are derived from Luwian, an Indo-European language whose dialects were once spoken in the Taurus mountains and Lycaonian plain
